H0.text: Solute and solvent are the two components that make up all solutions.

H1.text: Sodium and solvent are the two components of all solutions.

H2.text: Solute and cytosol are the two components of all solutions.

H3.text: Concentration and solvent are the two components of all solutions.

A4.text: In chemistry, a solution is defined by IUPAC as 'A liquid or solid phase containing more than one substance, when for convenience one (or more) substance, which is called the solvent, is treated differently from the other substances, which are called solutes.'

A5.text: One or more components present in the solution other than the solvent are called solutes.
